text: Bottle from Smakpiwa.pl. Aroma: Flowers, candies, ripe fruit, lightly malty. Appearance: Golden body, low head. Taste: Sour, flowery, light phenols, fruit, a bit of bitterish finish. Palate: Medium body, low carbonation, dry finish.

BOTTLE 33 CL. Hazy deep gold, white head wit so so retention. The aroma starts sweet, ripe fruit, honey and sugared dried figs, raisins. The sourness comes through after a while, along with a sweeter kind of funk with some hop dankness blended in. The taste is a more traditional lambic, medium acidity, subtle funk, subtle fruitiness and some dank hops in the finish. Nice.
Refrigerated 11.2 oz. brown bottle poured into a glass. Clear golden with big white head. Aroma is herbal hops, light body, well carbonated, and little lacing. Taste is funk and herbal hops.

5.5%ABV. Lambic

Tapped out light gold. 6¬∫SRM.

Nose has rose water, perfume and light sandalwood.

Palate has perfume and incense

Finish is similar.

This was the last of the trio for me and for me and the overall impression is as follows:
Simcoe: floral
Mosaic: lemon preserves
Centennial: rose water, perfume, incense

Bottle from McHughs. Pours cloudy gold with thin white head. Aroma is citrus, orange, bitter marmalade, funk, floral, perfume, bread, apple, berry. Flavour is a lime, green apple skin, lemon, dry white wine finish finish. Carbonated effervescent finish with lasting lime aftertaste. Complex and tasty.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Hazy yellow body. White head.
Nose of white wine, white wood, grapes, funk, hops, light cheese...
Flavour starts fruity and than turns crispy tart right away. Funk, sour, fruit, hop, berries, light dry, wood...
Aftertaste is tart, fruity, sour berries/grapes, funk and wood.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, more than just medium bodied. Very nice!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Pale honey yellow. Opaque. Moderate head. Acidic nose. Apples, other fruit, vinegar, horse blanket. Light body. Dry taste. Very tart. The hops deliver light bitterness. I liked it a lot.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle, shared at Superbowl Party poker event. Hazy pale yellow, lively white head. Leafy, funky nose. Tart pineapple, grassy and petroleum notes, dry finish. Nice complexity while maintaining drinkability.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Flaska p√• Bishops, √ñrebro. Blekgul, l√§tt disig. √ñrtig i doften med gr√∂nt humle, lite p√§ron och lite nedtonad citrus och citrusskal. Lite l√§ttare, torr kropp. Kryddig, √∂rtig med pigg humlekotte j√§mte en ganska sn√§ll och fr√§sch syra. L√§tt h√∂ig och torr, besk avslutning.

pours unclear very light golden with a small white cap offering some retention and lacing. leafy spicy citrus, obvious C going on, although an aged hop feeling persists or have i waited too long to open this one?, dried pineapples, softly bitter citrus, lightly tannic wood, light to medium acidity - mellow and relatively complex, dash of funk, esker salts. moderate carbonation, light body, gently tart and balanced woodsy-citrusy finish. intriguing leafy centennial in this nicely balanced unblended lambic. another solid spontandry-hopped declension.

Une bouteille de 33cl. Une robe dor√©e avec une mince couche de mousse blanche. Encore une fois un nez qui embaume, √† l¬íinstar du Citra, ce Centennial est superbe. Les effluves sauvages sont bien √©quilibr√©s. La bouche est bien agr√©able, pas trop juste assez avec une finale longue, savoureuse, facile et agr√©able. Maudit que c¬íest bon !

Bottle from Wine & Cheese. Pours gold with a foamy white head. Aroma is lightly funky - arguably floral - with a citrus note. Flavor is lightly sour, somewhat lightly funky, citrusy and I think floral. It¬ís an unusual flavor combination, but it¬ís quite nice. Dry, funky, bitter. Nice.

330ml on tap at Saint-Bock, Montreal, Quebec, Canada. Hazy golden/orange color, I had no head on top, I guess they wanted me to have a full full glass. Subtle hops aromas, citrus, sour/funky, lemon, dark berries. Pretty nice feeling on the tongue with the sparkling bubbles, sourness/ funkiness in there , you can taste wheat, lemon and get a resin, piny finish. Hops aren¬ít too present and perfectly blend with the lambic side. Great one!

Pours clear blonde, small White head. Smell is weak, more hoppy than anything else. No real sourness. Taste is vey mildly sour, doigh-maltyness. Very aromatic hops. Not bad. Yet less lambic-like than the other ones of the series

11.2 ounce bottle poured into a brandy snifter. The beer is a hazy orange with a white head of foam. The aroma has a grassy, herbal, doughy character to it. The beer starts out grassy and bitter at first, but turns sour and funky. Pretty neat how it does that. Medium body and medium carbonation. Solid beer.

12 ounces bottle shared with Jo. Aroma: flowers, citrus, herbs, light cat pee. App: cloudy golden, minimal white head leaving little lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, citrus, light smooth bitter finish. Overall: good fruity taste even though this might not be really fresh. Hops really shine through. Enjoyed it.

Bottle shared with Alex A: citrusy, piny, lemony. Some funk. App: hazy pale smallish white head some lacing. T/p: thin to med body with moderate long acidic finish. Moderate carbonation. O: I prefer the citra version over this still pretty decent brew. Nice citrusy feel on this.

330 ml bottle into tulip glass, best before 3/2/2021. Pours clear medium golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big tart/sour lemon, lime, grapefruit, orange peel, green apple, peach, apricot, guava, berry, citrus rind, oak, pepper, pine, hay, straw, leather, funk, wheat, cracker, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, citrus/pine hops, and light-moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big tart/sour lemon, lime, grapefruit, orange peel, green apple, peach, apricot, guava, berry, citrus rind, oak, pepper, pine, hay, straw, leather, funk, wheat, cracker, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Moderate pine/rind bitterness, lactic tartness, and yeast/tannic oak spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of tart lemon, lime, grapefruit, orange peel, green apple, guava, berry, citrus rind, pepper, pine, hay, straw, funk, and yeast/oak earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, citrus/pine hops, and light-moderate pale malt flavors; with a great malt/tart/bitter/spiciness balance, and zero astringent flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, crisp, dry, acidic, lightly sticky/resinous, and tannic/grainy balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5.5%. Overall this is an excellent dry hopped unblended Lambic! All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, citrus/pine hops, and light-moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and easy to drink with the moderate bitterness/acidity. A very enjoyable offering.

Bouteille 330ml. Couleur orang√©e trouble, mousse blanche laissant un anneau sur les parois du verre. Ar√¥me de levures sauvages, c√¥t√© lambic, pamplemousse, fermier. Go√ªt d¬íagrumes, amertume moyenne-√©lev√©e, levures sauvages, pamplemousse rose. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen-dense.

Well, this made it to the US, at least to Mikkeller Oakland! Bottle. Pours hazy golden, large off-white head, creamy, dissipates fairly slowly, good lacing. Aroma is dusty, light Brett, lemon peel, pine. Flavor is dry, light tart, light funk, fruity, citrus and pine. Medium body, soft mouthfeel. Solid beer, not quite up to the other two I have tried.

(33 cl. BB.02/03/21) Une robe dor√©e qui a une tr√®s petite t√™te. Un nez d√©licieux d¬íagrumes et de bon lambic avec une touche de fleurs et d¬íherbes. Une pointe d¬íoignon peut-√™tre? Oui, il me semble bien. Au go√ªt, voil√† une rencontre heureuse entre la capacit√© aromatique d¬íun houblon solide et la d√©licatesse d¬íun lambic fabriqu√© pour plaire √† tous et √† toutes. En bouche, agr√©able sensation d¬íun liquide vivant. En finale, aigreur contr√¥l√©e et aromates. Si facile √† boire, rafra√Æchissante, pleinement aim√©e.

Bottle 330ml @ home
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is tart with notes of malt, citrus, grape, pine, brett, barnyard and hint of peach. Taste is light to medium sweet, light to medium bitter and medium sour with a long dry, citrus, brett, barnyard and piney finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Slightly cloudy golden with a lasting white head. Citrus, berries, funk, grapes, spice and wood in the nose. Medium sour taste with a lingering grapfruitty bitterness. Very dry, high carbonation, warm alcoholic finish. I love the subtle way these hops complement the lambic aroma and taste. Amazing!

Bottle, june 26th 2016. Hazy yellow body with a thin white head. Aroma of lemon, hay, fruity hops, barnyard. Taste is funky and zesty with citric sourness. Crisp dry and sour finish, hopy aftertaste. Nice.

Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity weak sour hoppy citrus aroma. Fruity malty spicy sour hoppy citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy sour weak funky finish

33cl bottle. Leicht tr√ºbes goldenes Bier mit mittelgro√üen wei√üen schaumkrone. Geruch zitronig hopfig, citrusfr√ºchte, leicht s√§uerlich fruchtig. Geschmack trocken hopfig, zitronig, citrusfr√ºchte, s√ºffig, toll!

Pours a lightly hazy golden with a small to moderate white head that leaves pretty good lacing. Nose is of grassy and fruity hops with some light onions (or maybe garlic, actually). Taste is lightly tart and dry with a good bitterness and some nice hoppy moments. The lambic base is there also and nicely funky. Body is light, carbonation moderate and mouthfeel is almost juicy. A really nice refresher with a good level of hops, I like it a lot!
Spritziger, s√§uerlich herber Antrunk. Mild herb, wenig fruchtig, minimal bitter. Trocken bitter, gut. 10/11/10/11/11/11

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Sampled from 0.33 l bottle from ¬íPrik & Tik Baelus¬í, best before March 2021. Slightly hazy, golden yellow with a white head. Sourish-fruity, moderately funky aroma of lemon, gooseberry, pineapple and barnyard. Quite sour, quite fruity and moderately funky taste of lemon, gooseberry, pineapple, barnyard and some oak, followed by a medium long, slightly bitter, moderately tart and woody-dry finish. Thin to medium body, moderately astringent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Good!

Really enjoyable. Slick mouthfeel, lemon peel, light resin bitterness. Bone dry, bitterness is moderate and mild. The body is golden orange, good carbonation, inch of off white head. Nice dry, funky and tart acetic profile. Sourness lingers for 5 seconds and leaves dry aftertaste.

Tap @ Bevog Craft Beer Festival Austria 2016. Yellow golden colour, white foam head and aroma of floral citrus, melow fruity, lemon rind, funk. Taste is sour, grain, lemon zest, barnyard, tangy, with light bitterness. Slick mouthfeel, light to medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry sour finish.

Keg at BD hairy Bush, 19/09/16.
Light haze on a golden orange pour topped with an off white head.
Nose is fecal, earthy, horse blanket notes, lemon rind, damp hay.
Taste comprises lemon peel, straw, damp cloth, funk, grains, musty timber, light hop trace, light dung but not as intense as the aroma.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close with a funked up xour curtain call.
Ok but lower end for this series for me.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Tap Hazy yellow colour with small head.Aroma is funky and fruity with taste of citrus and elderflowers,mild sourish with tart and herbel nots flowers and good soft carbonation overall good refreshing taste.

(Bouteille provenant de Liquor Mart Whittier): Un nez herbac√© et tr√®s savonneux provenant d¬íun liquide purement dor√©e. En bouche c¬íest moelleux et souple avec une bonne acidit√© de pomme, des fruits exotiques et un bouquet fermier important.

330ml bottle pours a golden orange color with a finger of white head that leaves a few spots of lacing on the glass. Aroma is light fruits with some funky yeast notes and a hint of lemon. Taste is a light lemon tartness with some funk and a fruity and malty sweetness with a dry finish. Light bodied with decent carbonation. Overall, a fairly easy drinking lambic style brew that is balanced and tasty and unique. Recommended.

330mL bottle, pours a cloudy bright orange with a small white head. Aroma brings out dull bready dry hopping upfront, with light funk and some citrus. Flavour brings out lots of citrusy dry hoppng upfront, followed by medium barnyard funk and some leather. The centennial is showcased nicely here, even if it¬ís not my favourite hop. Funky and floral hoppy on the finish. Very good.
UPDATED: SEP 4, 2016 On tap at Taphouse, Copenhagen. Pours hazy amber with almost no head. Aroma of flowers, leather, medicine, apples, orange, spices. Taste watery sour with bitter aftertaste.
Bottle. Hazy yellow pour with small white head. Aroma has mild citrus and sour flowers. Taste is mild and balanced with a sour kick. Medium carbonation.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Mikkeller SpontanDryHop Centennial ].[ Trade by Rasmus40 ]. Light unclear medium yellow color with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate hoppy, grass, citrus, barnyard, leather, funky. Flavor is moderate sweet, light moderate acidic and moderate bitter with a long duration, grass, citrus, funky, leather, grapefruit, dry. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20160822]
Bottle 33 cl. Blurred gold. Aroma: sour, a little apple vinegar, cider, floral, citrus, fruits. Taste: apple, sour citrus, a little malt, fruits.

Gylden klar skum hvid 
Citrus grape eddike stald 
Sur lidt bitter modrate

@f1

Thank you for sharing! Sampled 330 ml. bottle @ Gents Bierfestival 2016. Hazy bright orange, few white bubbles fittingly. Nose is basic lemon sour, dirty frunk, indeed some wet mop, juicy raw funky hop, citrus zest,¬Ö Body is tad water, soft carbonation but it fits the beer & the style. Juicy hop taste, raw barn funk, dank zest, raw hop, dank, basic juicy lemon, zest, lemon, funk,¬Ö I liked it. Raw hop, zest,¬Ö Base is simple, raw funk & raw hop adds definitely to it. Second best between Citra, Simcoe & this one.
Can from Cotteridge Wines; hazy yellow pour with a thin white head, aroma has sour notes, some skunky action, taste has dank pine, tangerine, pine, soured yoghurt.

Small off-white rime over gold-orange, clear beer. Brett of the wet mop persusasion, animal cages, Oriental foodstores, moulded oranges. Sourish, floormop Brett, citrus. Light, acidic, acidthinning. Nose is too off-putting to be tolerable.

Una Sour davvero ottima per rinfrescarsi e ripulirsi il palato grazie alla sua accentuata carbonazione e alla, ovvia e richiesta dallo stile, acidit√†.
Si fa sentire la presenza del Brettanomyces ma in misura regolare, da non risultare fatidiosa.
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle (330 ml) shared with JulienHuxley. Slightly hazy golden-orange with a small ring of white foam leaving little lacing. Aroma is citusy, herbal notes, tropical notes, quite fruity. Taste is citric but not overly so with a mild lambic character, fun herbalness, tropical fruits and good tartness. Light to medium body. Moderate to medium carbonation. Fruity finish but also interestingly dry. Very easy drinking. Good dry-hopped sour.

Bottle shared with Tom. Hazy rich gold pour with thin foamy white head. Aroma is fruity, grassy, hoppy, nice pineapple. Taste is pretty tart, nice grassy notes, great fruity dry-hopped sour profile. Palate is med-light bodied, soft carbonation. Very nice.

Bottle from Tanakaya. Pours a slightly hazy yellow gold with a finger of foam that dissipates fairly quickly. Floral and grapefruit centennial notes on the nose dominate but as it warms more cobweb and musty aromas develop. Tart on the palate, but fairly easy drinking with lemon really standing out. More floral notes toward the finish with lemon continuing through. Some light gooseberry lingers. Tart and bitter on the finish. Solid.

Bottle at home from City Hops, I¬íd been hoping this brew made it stateside. Hazy golden orange small sudsy head. Nose is lemony citrus and some barnyard funk. Tastes of lemon, peach, wet wood, barn, funky, some florals, touch of fruit stripes gum. Decent palate dry and fruity. Lingering finish..
Some big funk aromas over a citrus back. Slightly hazy copper body light ring of head. Thin delicate sour nice fragrant dryness from the hops also a bit delicate.
Draft - pours yellow white head- nose and taste of grassy lemon, citrus and funky sour - medium body
Draft - Sour green grape and funky citrus. Clear gold with a white head. Light tartness some leafy notes. Nose is great but taste is a bit on the boring side. Clean and refreshing though.

Aroma: mango, barnyard, pineapple, leather, light citrus
Taste: light sour, tart, tannin, pineapple, leather, light barnyard

Bottle. Sensoric. Golden, little hazy with medium to big, white head. Medicare head retention and poor lacing. Fresh, sour and funky aroma. Quite strong citrus, cider barnyard and rotten hay notes. Taste is medium sour from the beginning, from the middle nicely bitter notes, which intensifies. Light to medium body, watery/creamy texture, lively carbonation, finish is dry and sour with bitter notes. In general very refreshing and drinkable beer, nice and smooth.

20.06.2016, 0,33l bottle @ home
Big fizzy-creamy longlasting head, slightly hazy. Aroma is slightly fresh sour-ish foresty, sour grass, moss, pine needles, fresh hops, minerals, lawn, leafs, hop pellets, hay, soda powder. Taste is slightly fresh sour-ish, soda powder, leafs, moss, lawn, fresh hops, pine needles, hop pellets, minerals, sorrel, citrus peel, flowers. Medium bitterness, slightly sour-ish dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Bottle. Pours slight hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is floral with a lot of funky notes, lemon zest, forrest leaves, citrus hops and oaky notes. The taste is tart and citrussy with a decent amount of funk and lemon peel. Also som dry floral notes and some grassy kinda hops as well. Good and all.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar SF. Pours cloudy golden with a clinging white head and a fruity aroma. There is a sourish pale malt flavor with a dry floral finish. Not as interesting as the other hop variations but still pretty drinkable.

330ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Small size, off-white head, stays. Leather, sweet, fruity, milky, peach in aroma. Sourish, fruity, yeasty, sweet in taste. Sourish, fruity aftertaste. Drinkable one.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2016 330ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut!
Nice sour aroma, good lambic. Taste is nice and lemony sharp lambic. Pretty decent lambic, but rather simple. Finish is nicely tart. Decent one.
Bottle (from mikkeller webshop). Pours golden. Aroma is sweet, sour, citrus, funk, medicinal. Flavor is sour and bitter, funk, apricot, citrus. Finish is slur and dry bitter. Overall: ok.

Bottle shared by Mart. Golden yellow beer, white head. Nose is citric and barnyardy, sweetness, tart notes in the background. Flavor is tart, barnyard notes, lemons, fruit. Dry finish, barnyard notes and lemons. Lingering dryness. Crisp mouthfeel, fizzy palate.

330ml bottle. Yellow golden colour, white foam head and aroma of floral citrus, melow fruity, lemon rind, funk. Taste is sour, grain, lemon zest, barnyard, tangy, with light bitterness. Slick mouthfeel, light to medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry sour finish. Very drinkable.

Hazy orange color with off-white head. Aroma has farmhouse funk and some floral hops. Taste starts tart with cider notes, pickles, dank hops. Light body with medium carbonation. Overall it¬ís good but the others from the series were better. The hops on this one were not as aromatic as I expected.
33cl bottle from saveur-biere.com. Hazy gold color. Thin white head. Medium sourness, light sweetness, medium bitterness. Medium dry finish. Aroma is cheese, barnyard, hoppy, fruity, herby.
Tap @ Basement Beer Bar, Aalborg. Aroma of herbs, centennial, tartness. Clear amber colour with white head, not lasting. Light+ acidic, light bitter. Light+ body, dry feel, light sour finish.

330 mml bottle tasted on the 28/05/2016. Cloudy golden colour with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, floral notes, hops and brettanomyces. Taste is acid and hoppy. Presence of fruits and malts too. Hoppy, dry and fruity finish. Next one please.

[5/10/16] Draught at Mikkeller & Friends in Copenhagen. Golden. Aroma of of "green" hops, piney and citric, and nice funk. Tart and mildly bitterish flavor, with funk, fruitiness, and citric "green" hops. Medium-bodied. Very good.
Bottle at Dangerous bottleshares 20th edition!! Featuring Zakoon and Aaron. Cloudy golden pour with a frothy head. Notes of citrus peel, funk, sticky hops, light tartness and some light peach.

At home, 33cl bottle - expiry date: 0203/2021.
Pour: golden yellow, looks like apple cider, light foggy, good head that dissipates relatively fast.
Smell: dry hay, hops, fruit, wet rotten hay.
Taste: lightly bitter, wet hay, citrus at end, subtle lambicish sourness develops.
Mouthfeel: high carbonation, dry bitterness, very slight acid.
Verdict: One on hand, very interesting and balanced beer with a really nice interplay between the hoppy bitterness and the spontaneous sourness. On the other hand, it just seems a little too balanced for my tastes! I miss more dominant flavours. Although with time (and maybe increased temperature) the taste leaned more over to the sour side, which was a win. Will probably try this again.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Poured a hazy light amber with a thin broken white head. The aroma is zesty citrus, sweet fake sugar. The flavour is light sour with a dry crisp fresh aspirin acid light citrus palate. Medium to light bodied with average carbonation.

Bottle shared. Near clear golden orange with a very short lived small white head. Aroma of grapefruit, barnyard funk, Bretty, citrus and light fruity notes. Flavour is moderate sour. Light to light medium bodied with light moderate fizzy carbonation.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear golden blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: hoppy and fruity, dry fruits and candied fruit notes. Small sourness. Taste: medium body with hoppy and grassy notes. Balanced with sourness. I was a little bit disappointed when I was drinking this beer. Not hoppy and no sourness complexity. It¬ís hoppy and acid that¬ís all. Good attenuation. Quiet drinkable. Aftertaste: grassy notes.
Bottled:Hazy golden with a mid sized head. Sourish aroma of orange marmalade and grapefruit. Sourish taste with lots of lime and grapefruit. Long bitterness.

Bottle, 5.5%. Hazy dark yellow with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, lemon, brett, zest, barnyard, hops and grapefruit. Flavour is malt, brett, lemon, zest, barnyard, little dry, little sweet, hops, grapefruit, oak, citrus, little sour, little citric and medium bitter.

Tap @ Basement Beer Bar, Aalborg. Hazy golden with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, barnyard and light hoppy - citrus. Flavor is medium and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 060516

Tap @ Christian 4tal Pale Ale Festival 2016, Odense. Pours hazy golden with a off white head. Spicy and yeasty. Herbal barnyardy and a touch of popcorn - not as much as the rest in the series. Funky dry finish.

April 30, 2016. Bottle. 
Hazy golden with a medium sized, slightly frothy white head. Aroma is 
grassy, funky and fruity with orange zest, grapefruit, light barnyard, some earthy notes. Taste is light sweet, funky, fruity and soft sour. Finish is slight dry grassy, piney and pithy bitterness, some earthy and funky notes, wet leaves. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation. 
Quite good.

Tap. Hazy orange beer with a white head. Aroma has fruits, spices, hops, acid and some chemical smell I can¬ít quite figure out what is (dish wash soap?). Taste of citra, hops, spices and malt with a weak finish of grass and earth.

Sample from bottle, poured a clear orange colour with a white head. Nose of fresh pressed citrus, tart notes, light malted, fruited notes, cranberries, Dried Peach, wheat, almost vinegar tartness. Slightly oxidized. refreshing.

Aroma and taste is medium sour fruity, barnyard and orchard fruit, light vinegar, wood, dry on the palate, fruity dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at Taphouse.
Hazy amber colored with a small white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of oak and hops.
Fruity and light acidic flavor of oak and barnyard with notes of hops.
Hoppy finish.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2016 Flaska en trappa upp, pitchers √∂rebro. Gyllengul kul√∂r. Kemisk doft som drar √•t diskvatten. Citrus och syrlig frukt. Halm och √∂rter. L√§tt syrlig och viss viss humlebeska. Lite f√∂r mittemellan.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity weak sour hoppy citrus aroma. Fruity malty spicy sour hoppy citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy sour weak funky finish.
Citrus aroma with yeasty undertones. Pours light golden with small, white, frothy head. Sour taste, lemon and berries. Light body, feels thin and lively. Decent.

Bottle at home. Clear golden - white head. Fresh acidic redapple aroma. Nice wooden. Nice mouldy notes. Citrus. Earthy. Light oxidation notes. Nice fruity hoppy. Some peaches. Light acidic. Mild sourness. Some fruit sweetness. Nice balance,
Tap at c4. Unclear golden body with a small head. Tart, fruity, peach, lemon, light vinegar, hops. Good.

Sample c4. Pours hazy Yellow with a White head. Aroma of sour, tarty, grassy, light peach, light honey dew. Taste is sour, tarty, fruity, light honey dew, quite hoppy. Tart finish, very light vinegar.

On tap at Christian Firtal. Cloudy golden with a small white head. Fruity aroma with citrus and peach along with grass, autumn leaves, and a bit of funk. Sweet, tart flavour with a lot of grass and leaves. Tasty, even if my deScriptors didn¬ít quite sound so...

Bottle Cloudy golden body with white fast disappearing white head. Aroma is some fruity sourness with hints of bretts. Taste is fruity sour with nice dryness in the background. Aftertaste is more sour than bitter. Nice one but missing the hops.

Bottle. 
Slightly hazy light golden color, tiny white head. 
Very sour nose, taste is hoppy with a clear sour note. 
Medium body, soft carbonation.
From tap at Taphouse. Unclear golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, spice, hops, peach, grapefruit and tartness.

Bottled. Pours slightly hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, floral notes, funk and barnyard. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Light to medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice  Sour. üåüüåüüåüüåü

Tap @Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade. Pours clear golden with a small, staying creamy white head. Aroma has fresh hops, grass, grapefruit, pine needles, tart, light lactic and vinegar. Medium, lively carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good tartness, funk, citrus, grapefruit, light pine, some grapes. Fine balance.

Draft. A hazy golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of fruits, spices, hops, and brettanomyces. The flavor is acidic with notes of brettanomyces, fruits, hops, spices, and malt, leading to a tart finish.

33 cl bottle. Pours hazy yellow to orange with a small white head. Aroma is pine, grapefruity and soapy hoppy. Brett and slight herbal. Citric, smooth fruity, peachy and grapefruity. Sour and slight citric. Smooth and fruity finish. Crisp hoppy finsh.

17/III/16 - 33cl bottle @ De Proefbrouwerij (Lochristi) - BB: 2/III/21 (2016-278) Thanks to Dirk for the excellent tour and samples!
Clear blond beer, small irregular white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: bit soapy, lemony, floral, grapefruit, pretty heavy smell. MF: lively carbon, medium body. Taste: bitter, pretty lemony, tannins, bit soapy, grapefruit. Aftertaste: sour, bitter, fruity, bit floral, lemony, some nice highlights.
